GeneralInformation.History: A multidisciplinary educational institution established in 1991

Founded in 1990. Renamed Lietuvos Teisės Universitetas (Law University of Lithuania) in 2000. Acquired present title and status in 2004. Established shortly after Lithuania regained its independence, MRU is dedicated to advancing the values of democracy, transparency, human dignity, and inclusivity. Over the years, MRU has grown alongside the nation, playing a pivotal role in fostering public governance, legal expertise, and research that contributes to both national and global progress. In 2004 named after Mykolas Romeris, and a leading statesman of interwar Lithuania, the university embodies his commitment to the rule of law and democratic principles.
AdmissionRequirements: Students are admitted according to average marks in selected exams, plus the average of annual marks in relative subjects
Admission requirements for overseas students are available on the University website

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1579 as Academica et Universitas Vilnensis with two Faculties: Philosophy and Theology. Reorganized 1781 and again 1803 as the Imperial University of Vilnius. Closed by Tsarist Government 1832 when Faculties of Medicine and Theology became separate Academies. Reopened 1919. Closed during German occupation 1943.
Founded in 1992 in Minsk, Belarus. Closed by authorities in 2004. Relaunched in Lithuania in 2005. Acquired current status as an official Lithuanian university in 2006
GeneralInformation.AcademicYear: October to September (October - February; March - September)
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (Vidurinės Mokyklos Baigimo Atestatas); Entrance examination

Address.college_name: ISM University of Management and Economics

GeneralInformation.History: Founded by BI Norwegian Business School in 1999. Formerly International School of Management (ISM), Tarptautinė Auskštoji Mokykla (ISM)

Divisions.Details: Co-operation with the BI Norwegian Business School

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1922, became University of Lithuania 1922 and University of Kaunas 1940. Technical Department detached and re-organized into Kaunas Polytechnic Institute 1950. Acquired university status 1990
Established as Lithuania Christian College in the summer of 1991 in Panevėžys. Relocated to the Baltic port city, Klaipėda, in 1992. Acquired present status and title in 2000
GeneralInformation.AcademicYear: September to May (September-December; January-May) plus June and July summer sessions.
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (Brandos Atestatas); English proficiency test

Divisions.College: Teaching English to Speakers of Other Languages

Address.college_name: Lithuanian Academy of Music and Theatre

GeneralInformation.History: Founded in 1933, an internationally recognized institution training artists for a professional career in music, theatre, dance and film and offers related theoretical studies. Formerly Lietuvos Muzikos Akademija. In 1949 the Conservatoire of Kaunas and the Conservatoire of Vilnius (founded in 1945) were merged into the Lithuanian State Conservatoire. In 1992 the Conservatoire was renamed Lithuanian Academy of Music (LMA), and in 2004 Lithuanian Academy of Music and Theatre (LMTA)

AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (Brandos Atestatas); Certificate of English proficiency

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1922 as a Faculty of Medicine of Kaunas University. Reorganized into a separate Kaunas Medical Institute 1950. Became Kaunas Medical Academy 1989. Acquired present title 2010 following merge with Lithuanian Veterinary Academy
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (Brandos atestatas); Entrance examination

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1948 as Teacher Training Institute. Acquired present status and title 1997 with the merging of Šiauliai Pedagogigal Institute and Šiauliai Polytechnical Faculty of Kaunas Technological University.
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (Vidurines Mokyklos Baigimo Atestatas); Curriculum Vitae; Letter of Motivation; Certificate of English language proficiency

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1793 as the Department of Architecture at the University of the Grand Duchy of Lithuania. Reorganized 1941 and acquired present status and title 1990. A State institution
Founded as Vilnius branch of Kaunas Polytechnic Institute in 1956. Became Vilnius Civil Engineering Institute in 1969. Acquired present status in 1990 and title in 1996.
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (Brandos Atestatas) or foreign equivalent; Entrance examination based on applicant's background and chosen program; Certificate of English proficiency

Address.college_name: Vilnius University – International Business School at Vilnius University
Address.university_name: Vilniaus universitetas – Vilniaus universiteto Tarptautinio verslo mokykla

GeneralInformation.History: Integrated as a faculty of Vilnius University in 2016.
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (Brandos Atestatas) or foreign equivalent; Certificate of English proficiency

GeneralInformation.History: Established as University of Lithuania in 1922. Closed in 1950, then re-established in 1980. Aleksandras Stulginskis University and the Lithuanian University of Educational Sciences integrated in 2019. A State Institution.

Address.college_name: Vytautas Magnus University – Vytautas Magnus University Education Academy
Address.university_name: Vytauto Didžiojo Universitetas – Vytauto Didžiojo universitetas Švietimo akademija – Lithuanian University of Educational Sciences (VMU)

GeneralInformation.History: Founded as Pedagogical Institute of the Republic in 1935. Received the title of Vilnius Pedagogical Institute in 1991. Renamed once again as Lithuanian University of Educational Sciences in 2011. Reorganized as a part of Vytautas Magnus University and earned present title in 2018.

Address.college_name: Vytautas Magnus University – Vytautas Magnus University Agriculture Academy
Address.university_name: Vytauto Didžiojo Universitetas – Vytauto Didžiojo universiteto Žemės ūkio akademija – Aleksandras Stulginskis University (VMU Agriculture Academy)

GeneralInformation.History: The Agricultural Academy was established on September 3rd, 1924 in Dotnuva. On October 8th, 1996, the name of Lithuanian Academy of Agriculture was changed to Lithuanian University of Agriculture. Lithuanian University of Agriculture was granted the name of Aleksandras Stulginskis University in 2011. Earned present status and title in 2019
